sentences.sContent: Business was booming , and money wasn’t a problem.
sentences.sCn: 生意非常兴隆，钱已不是问题。

sentences.sContent: Tourism on the island has boomed.
sentences.sCn: 岛上的旅游业迅速发展。

sentences.sContent: ...The North American shale gas boom has resulted in record low prices there...
...Perhaps the best example of boom growth and bust decline is the Grand Banks fishery...
...which also leads to the rise of affluent middle class has seen an unprecedented boom in travelling...
...The current business-book boom was launched in 1982 by Tom Peters and Robert Waterman with In Search of Excellence...
...Well the biggest change has been the decrease in sales since the great boom years of the 1980s when champagne production and sales reached record levels...
...Of course since those boom years sales have fallen...

phrases.pCn: 超音波爆声；音爆（等于sonic bang）
婴儿潮一代；生育高峰代

words.tran: 兴旺的，繁荣的；大受欢迎的
生育高峰中出生的人；赶往新兴地区安家的人；发出隆隆声者；发育完全的雄袋鼠
兴旺（boom的ing形式）；发出隆隆声

trans.tranCn: 激增， 繁荣， 迅速发展； 发出隆隆声
trans.tranOther: if business, trade, or a particular area is booming, it is increasing and being very successful

trans.tranCn: 激增，繁荣，迅速发展；隆隆声，嗡嗡声
trans.tranOther: a quick increase of business activity
